revised_title: Researches on the Structure, Physiology, and Development of Antedon rosaceus: Part I
tldr: This article delves into the structure, physiology, and development of Antedon rosaceus, a unique representative of the Crinoidea order. The author provides a historical summary of previous research and findings, and discusses the significance of Antedon as a 'typical form' in understanding the broader Crinoidea group. The study aims to contribute to the understanding of the structure, physiology, and life-history of this species and its implications for the Crinoidea order as a whole.
